title: Episode 91: Greta Gerwig, Ping Pong Politics, and the Sleep Elite
description: This week: Actress Greta Gerwig finds the right dress for the big time… Two ping pong players thaw the Cold War… And the “sleep elite” put shuteye to rest. Plus a joke from Texas musician/artist Terry Allen and “The Morning” from The Weeknd [sic].
contentencoded:
This week: Actress Greta Gerwig finds the right dress for the big time… Two ping pong players thaw the Cold War… And the “sleep elite” put shuteye to rest. Plus a joke from Texas musician/artist Terry Allen and “The Morning” from The Weeknd [sic].


Icebreaker: Terry Allen

Artist and Texas music legend Terry Allen shares his pet phrase.


Small Talk: Dressy Dressing Rooms, Craigslist for Cockroaches, Costco Weddings

The staff from Marketplace dig up some lesser-known headlines…like the fact that Costco is now in the diamond ring business.


Radio listeners heard Reyhan Harmanci — Culture Editor at San Francisco’s Bay Citizen — tell us about an elite group of folks genetically predisposed to sleep better than you.


A History Lesson with Booze: Ping Pong Diplomacy and the “Chairman Wow”

This week back in 1971, a chance encounter between two ping pong players — one American, one Chinese — led to a thaw in the cold war, and paved the way for President Nixon’s biggest political coup. Hear all about it, then bounce a jugful of this custom cocktail back and forth between friends:


The “Chairman Wow” – as served up by Shanghai barman Logan Brouse.


For a six-serving jug, pour:



  • 3/10 bottle of Bourbon or whiskey

  • Cold store-bought green tea


Into a large pitcher with ice. Stir in honey to taste. Drink backhanded for additional “Wow” factor.


Guest of Honor: Greta Gerwig

Don’t take our word for it, the New York Times said 28-year-old Greta Gerwig might be “the definitive actress of her generation”. Closely associated with “mumblecore” – a group of micro-budget films populated by twenty-somethings who often don’t speak clearly – Gerwig crosses over into mainstream movies this weekend with her co-starring role in the remake of “Arthur.” She talks to Brendan about cat puns, Joan Didion and colorblind love.


One For The Road: The Weeknd – “The Morning”

The Weeknd just released a mixtape this Sunday that’s got the music world abuzz. Is it hipster-R&B? Is it a smoother breed of rap, a la Drake? But classifications seem irrelevant when you hear “The Morning,” which begins with a Hendrix-like guitar riff, lays down a swooning futuristic beat, and then segues into heady, emotional lyrics. It’s a strong brew perfect for waking you up.


Music On This Week’s Show:


Sea & Cake – “The Argument”


The Wedding Present – “Signal”


Tipsy – “Liquordelic”


CDR – “1+1+3”


P.K. 14 – “Sleeping Furiously”


En Vogue – “Free Your Mind”


The Weeknd – “The Morning”


DPD Players – “Yahtzee with Gaddafi!”
